caption.p: Apoptotic effect of the extracted pigments on human cancer cells. ( A) The apoptosis percentages in pigment- and 5-FU-treated cancer cells after staining with annexin and propidium iodide relative to the percentages in untreated cancer cells with ( B) Dot plot flow charts of the untreated and treated cancer cells. ( C) Fluorescence images of pigment-treated cancer cells compared with those of 5-FU-treated cancer cells and untreated cancer cells after staining with acridine orange and ethidium bromide and investigation using fluorescence microscopy (green, yellowish-orange, and red fluorescence indicates viable, early apoptotic and late apoptotic cells, respectively) (magnification ×200). ( D) The superior potency of pigments relative to 5-FU as caspase 3/7 activators in the treated Caco-2 cells. ( E) IC 50 values reflecting the inhibitory effect of pigments and 5-FU on matrix metalloprotease (MMP) 9. All data are expressed as the mean ± SE with significance (unpaired t-test analysis) at p-value < 0.05*, <0.005**, <0.0005***.
